description: This is a Kotlin source file defining the 'MenuFragment' class, which is a UI component in an Android app. It manages displaying a restaurant's menu, handling interactions like adding items to cart, favoriting, and reviewing. It also manages ratings, reviews, and recommended items sections within the fragment.

classes.name: MenuFragment
classes.description: A Fragment class that displays a restaurant's menu, categories, ratings, reviews, and recommended items, allowing user interactions such as adding to cart, favoriting, and reviewing.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the adapter and sets up the fragment, handling arguments passed during instantiation.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Sets up UI components, observes data sources for ratings, reviews, recommended items, and manages user interactions.

methods.name: setupCategoryChips
methods.description: Creates and manages category filter chips for menu filtering.

methods.name: openOptionsAndAdd
methods.description: Opens a bottom sheet to select options/configuration for a menu item and adds it to the cart.

methods.name: openReviewsForMenuItem
methods.description: Opens a dialog to display reviews for a specific menu item.
